text: Ragnvald Mikal Andersen (26 March 1899 – 28 February 1995) was a Norwegian politician for the Labour Party. He was born in Bergen. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Bergen in 1958, but was not re-elected. He had previously served as a deputy representative during the term 1954-1957, and later served in the same position from 1961-1965\. On the local level Andersen was a member of Bergen city council from 1954 to 1959. Andersen spent his entire career as a ship mechanic, and was active in the Norwegian Confederation of Trade Unions. ==References== * Category:1899 births Category:1995 deaths Category:Members of the Storting Category:Labour Party (Norway) politicians Category:Politicians from Bergen Category:Norwegian trade unionists Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Ragnvald Mikal Andersen
